subject: PSCI
title: Field Course
description: A combination of academic study and field experience that expose students to "real-world" political scenarios, including important political gatherings, such as the meetings of the International Monetary Fund/World Bank in Washington, DC; or sites of political significance, such as Israel/Palestine. [Note: This is a repeatable course, subject to different content; it may be completed a total of two times. Course will be graded on a CR/NCR basis. Additional fees required.]
